results.title: Sub-igloo
results.creator_credit: Colin Low, James de B. Domville, Joseph MacInnis and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Film report from a Canadian scientific expedition that put a plastic bubble on the floor of the Arctic Ocean to serve as workshop and rest station for scientists working below the Arctic ice. What it took, in both planning and on-the-spot improvisation, to chop through the heavy ice, and to lower and anchor the huge dome in place in the dark and cold of Resolute Bay, is fully illustrated by film and commentary. Award: Bordeaux.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Colin Low, James de B. Domville, Joseph MacInnis and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Style wars
results.creator_credit: Tony Silver, Henry Chalfant and Public Art Films
results.brief_description: Examines New York’s “hiphop” subculture - the cradle of graffiti, breakdancing and rap music movements which have rocked the international worlds of art and entertainment. Cleverly juxtaposes the viewpoints of the graffiti writers, with those of law enforcement officers and government officials. Mayor Koch advocates five days in jail for repeat “graffiti” offenders and it would appear that there doesn’t seem to be much attempt by those working for the system to understand this sub-culture.

results.title: Germaine Greer's Sydney
results.creator_credit: John McGreevy, Pat Ferns, John McGreevy Productions and Nielsen-Ferns International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Cities”.
A look at Sydney with Germaine Greer. She comments on it being a city “where the poorest people can be millionaires. Where, for practically nothing, you can do the same things that in other countries you have to join select clubs to do.”

results.title: Hildegard Knef's Berlin
results.creator_credit: John McGreevy, Pat Ferns, John McGreevy Productions and Nielsen-Ferns International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Cities”.
Hildegard Knef opens Berlin to the viewers of this film in an extensively historical yet highly personal manner. She introduces us to her personal family history and to the ramifications of Nazi power. The tour also includes historical footage of the “formidable women who cleaned up the rubble of demolished Berlin” after World War II, of John Kennedy’s famous speech declaring his Berlin citizenship, of the 15-foot-high concrete barricade that divides the city, and of the airlift that kept the city of two million people totally supplied.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John McGreevy, Pat Ferns, John McGreevy Productions and Nielsen-Ferns International

results.title: Studs Terkel's Chicago
results.creator_credit: John McGreevy, Pat Ferns, John McGreevy Productions and Nielsen-Ferns International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Cities”.
Studs Terkel, a resident of Chicago since his childhood, proudly displays the city and its ‘ethnic parade’. The ‘parade’ takes us on a view of Picasso’s statue, of Louis Sullivan’s skyscrapers, on a ride on the ‘El’ and a visit to the ‘Loop’. Terkel also takes us to the Chicago River, the Art Institute, Lincoln Park, Maxwell Street and finally, into the ethnic areas decorated by proud people.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John McGreevy, Pat Ferns, John McGreevy Productions and Nielsen-Ferns International

results.title: Jonathan Miller's London
results.creator_credit: John McGreevy, Pat Ferns and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Cities”.
Dr Jonathan Miller gives his personal view of the historical development of the city of London including his own personal upbringing in that city.

results.title: Sudden departure
results.creator_credit: Georges Dufaux, Marcel Martin and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: When an infant or small child enters hospital, there can be dangerous emotional shock caused by separation from the mother. Filmed at a children’s hospital, this film examines the nature of the child’s deprivation. A psychiatrist discusses what parents can do to lessen fear and anxiety. (Awards: Cairo; La Plata.)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Georges Dufaux, Marcel Martin and National Film Board of Canada
